content.title: Malperfusion Syndromes in Aortic Dissection
content.description: Ischemic complications from branch vessel compromise in aortic dissection, occurring via static or dynamic obstruction mechanisms.

mechanisms.dynamic_obstruction: True lumen collapse from false lumen pressurization; flap oscillates across branch ostia
mechanisms.static_obstruction: Dissection extends into branch vessel, or false lumen thrombosis occludes branch

visceral.presentation: Abdominal pain, elevated lactate, liver dysfunction

treatment_principles.type_a: Central aortic repair first (often resolves malperfusion)
treatment_principles.type_b: TEVAR to restore true lumen flow ± branch stenting
